title.native: 好きでも嫌いなあまのじゃく

description:
Yearning to get along with others and not be disliked, first-year high school student Hiiragi finds himself unable to say no whenever someone requests something of him. One summer day, while unsuccessfully carrying out yet another request, he encounters an oni girl named Tsumugi, who has come to the human world to search for her mother. She does whatever she pleases and is the complete opposite of Hiiragi. Snow mysteriously begins to fall... and their adventure begins.

(Source: Netflix, edited)
hashtag: #好きでも嫌いなあまのじゃく
synonyms: มาย โอนิ เกิร์ล

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomotaka_shiba)

At the start of his career he worked at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) as a digital painter and only switched to animating after leaving the company. He has taken part in numerous of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' productions since the release of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/). Currently he working as a director at [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/151217/)._

__[Website](https://zutomayo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo_staff) | [Instagram (run by ACA-NE)](https://www.instagram.com/zutomayo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv6P5nsS9rP4tDtFlqLU_QQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/38WbKH6oKAZskBhqDFA8Uj?si=5bjHWeOJTmKT7BgIOkRdJA)__

__Introduction:__
Zutto Mayonaka de Iinoni, better known by their international name Zutomayo (stylized as ZUTOMAYO), is a Japanese rock band under record label EMI Records Japan, affiliated with Watanabe Entertainment. 

The group is quite secretive by nature, seeing as they have never released a full member list, with each work crediting different people for their music production, lyrics, composition and arrangement. The only reoccurring member is the vocalist, who is only known as an unindentified woman going by the stage name "ACA-NE" (pronounced Akane). It can additionally be noted that their secrecy is a contributing factor to their popularity.

__Biography:__
Zutomayo debuted by releasing their first song "Byoushin wo Kamu" on YouTube on June 4, 2018. The song became an immediate hit on release, garnering 200,000 views within its first week on the platform. Additionally, after releasing the single through streaming platforms on August 30, the song became the most streamed song that week. Following their song's release, Zutomayo held their first concert at the Daikanyama Loop in Tokyo. Attendees were handed opaque glasses and reported that the entire venue was dark for the duration of the concert. The group would continue to conceal their identities in future concerts as well.

Zutomayo released two more singles digitally before releasing their first EP, Tadashii Itsuwari Kara no Kishou, on November 14 in the same year, through record label EMI Records Japan. The EP peaked 8th on the Oricon Albums Chart and was nominated in the 19th CD Shop Awards. On June 5, 2019, a second EP was released titled Imawa Imade Chikaiwa Emide, which peaked at the number one spot on the Oricon chart. Later in that same year on October 30, they would release their first full-length album titled Hisohiso Banashi.

__Members:__
- [ACA-NE](https://anilist.co/staff/170316/ACANE) (ACAね, Akane) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics and composition

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%9A%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A8%E7%9C%9F%E5%A4%9C%E4%B8%AD%E3%81%A7%E3%81%84%E3%81%84%E3%81%AE%E3%81%AB%E3%80%82), edited)

__[Website](https://zutomayo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo_staff) | [Instagram (run by ACA-NE)](https://www.instagram.com/zutomayo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv6P5nsS9rP4tDtFlqLU_QQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/38WbKH6oKAZskBhqDFA8Uj?si=5bjHWeOJTmKT7BgIOkRdJA)__

__Introduction:__

The group is quite secretive by nature, seeing as they have never released a full member list, with each work crediting different people for their music production, lyrics, composition and arrangement. The only reoccurring member is the vocalist, who is only known as an unindentified woman going by the stage name "ACA-NE" (pronounced Akane). It can additionally be noted that their secrecy is a contributing factor to their popularity.

__Biography:__
Zutomayo debuted by releasing their first song "Byoushin wo Kamu" on YouTube on June 4, 2018. The song became an immediate hit on release, garnering 200,000 views within its first week on the platform. Additionally, after releasing the single through streaming platforms on August 30, the song became the most streamed song that week. Attendees were handed opaque glasses and reported that the entire venue was dark for the duration of the concert. The group would continue to conceal their identities in future concerts as well.

Zutomayo released two more singles digitally before releasing their first EP, Tadashii Itsuwari Kara no Kishou, on November 14 in the same year, through record label EMI Records Japan. Later in that same year on October 30, they would release their first full-length album titled Hisohiso Banashi.

__Members:__
- [ACA-NE](https://anilist.co/staff/170316/ACANE) (ACAね, Akane) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics and composition

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%9A%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A8%E7%9C%9F%E5%A4%9C%E4%B8%AD%E3%81%A7%E3%81%84%E3%81%84%E3%81%AE%E3%81%AB%E3%80%82), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo)

ACA-NE, alternatively pronounced as Akane, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the rock band [Zutomayo](https://anilist.co/staff/170315/ZUTOMAYO).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo)

ACA-NE, alternatively pronounced as Akane, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the rock band [Zutomayo](https://anilist.co/staff/170315/ZUTOMAYO).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/100outo) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZAgssIVgZSOv8UxjRd2knQ)

100kaiOuto is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and music producer.

Henrique Canales is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
